The '''Gulf of Lune''' was a sea-arm in the rough shape of an arrowhead{{fact}} that broke through the range of the [[Blue Mountains|Ered Luin]] into [[Eriador]].

The Gulf of Lune, named after the river [[Lhûn]] or "Lune", was created during the [[War of Wrath]] when [[Beleriand]] was broken. [[Belegaer]] broke through the mountains of the Ered Luin, creating a gulf. The course of the river Lhûn was altered so that it flowed into the gulf, giving it its name.<ref>{{S|Rings}}</ref>

The remnant of Beleriand north of the gulf became known as [[Forlindon]], and the part south of it as [[Harlindon]]. At the eastern end of the Gulf the [[Grey Havens]] were established, but smaller havens were established in Forlindon and Harlindon as well: [[Forlond]] and [[Harlond (Lindon)|Harlond]].

During the [[Second Age]] the ships of the [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]]s first came to the Gulf of Lune to visit the [[Noldor]] and [[Sindar]] under [[Gil-galad]] who remained behind, and during the [[Third Age]] from it the ships of the [[Eldar]] passed away into the [[Aman|West]].

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2001-03: [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]]:'''
:For the maps produced for use in the movies, [[Daniel Reeve]] changed the coastline of the Gulf of Lune by giving it the shape of New Zealand's Wellington Harbour.
